title: GenServer Call vs Cast
source:
sequenceDiagram
    participant C as Client
    participant G as GenServer
    C->>+G: call(:get_state)
    G-->>-C: {:ok, state}
    Note over C,G: Synchronous - blocks client
    C-)+G: cast(:update, val)
    Note over G: Asynchronous - returns immediately
    G->>G: handle_cast
    Note over G: Updates state without reply

title: GenServer State Management
source:
flowchart TD
    A[Client Request] --> B{handle_call/3}
    B --> C[Read Current State]
    C --> D[Compute New State]
    D --> E[Return Reply + New State]
    E --> F[GenServer updates state]
    F --> G[Ready for next request]

title: GenServer Timeout Patterns
source:
sequenceDiagram
    participant C as Client
    participant G as GenServer
    C->>+G: call(:slow_operation, 5000)
    Note over G: Processing...
    alt Completes in time
        G-->>-C: {:ok, result}
    else Timeout after 5s
        G--xC: :timeout error
        Note over C: Client can retry or fail gracefully
    end

title: GenServer Initialization Flow
source:
sequenceDiagram
    participant S as Supervisor
    participant G as GenServer
    participant D as Database
    S->>+G: start_link(args)
    G->>G: init(args)
    G->>D: Load initial data
    D-->>G: Data
    alt Initialization succeeds
        G-->>-S: {:ok, pid}
        Note over S: Child added to supervisor
    else Initialization fails
        G--xS: {:error, reason}
        Note over S: Supervisor may retry based on strategy
    end

title: Supervision Tree Structure
source:
flowchart TD
    A[Application] --> B[Top Supervisor]
    B --> C[Cache Manager]
    B --> D[Worker Supervisor]
    B --> E[Database Pool]
    D --> F[Worker 1]
    D --> G[Worker 2]
    D --> H[Worker 3]
    style B fill:#4a5568
    style D fill:#4a5568

title: Supervisor Restart Strategies
source:
flowchart LR
    A[Child Crashes] --> B{Restart Strategy}
    B -->|one_for_one| C[Restart only crashed child]
    B -->|one_for_all| D[Restart all children]
    B -->|rest_for_one| E[Restart crashed + children started after it]
    style B fill:#d69e2e

title: Process Crash and Restart Flow
source:
sequenceDiagram
    participant S as Supervisor
    participant W as Worker
    participant N as New Worker
    W->>W: Crash!
    W--xS: :EXIT signal
    Note over S: Detects child exit
    S->>S: Check restart strategy
    alt Under max_restarts threshold
        S->>+N: start_link(args)
        N-->>-S: {:ok, pid}
        Note over S: Worker restored
    else Exceeded max_restarts
        S->>S: Shutdown
        S-->>App: Escalate to parent supervisor
    end

title: Kafka Topic and Consumer Groups
source:
flowchart LR
    P[Producer] --> T[Topic: orders]
    T --> |Partition 0| C1[Consumer A - Group 1]
    T --> |Partition 1| C2[Consumer B - Group 1]
    T --> |Partition 2| C3[Consumer C - Group 1]
    T --> |All Partitions| C4[Consumer - Group 2]
    style T fill:#d69e2e

title: Broadway Pipeline Processing
source:
flowchart LR
    K[Kafka] --> P[Producer]
    P --> B1[Batch 1]
    P --> B2[Batch 2]
    P --> B3[Batch 3]
    B1 --> Proc1[Process]
    B2 --> Proc2[Process]
    B3 --> Proc3[Process]
    Proc1 --> Ack[Acknowledge]
    Proc2 --> Ack
    Proc3 --> Ack
    style P fill:#4a5568
    style Ack fill:#48bb78

title: Event Sourcing Pattern
source:
flowchart TD
    C[Command] --> A[Aggregate]
    A --> E1[Event 1]
    A --> E2[Event 2]
    E1 --> ES[Event Store/Kafka]
    E2 --> ES
    ES --> P1[Projection 1: Read Model]
    ES --> P2[Projection 2: Analytics]
    ES --> P3[Projection 3: Notifications]
    style ES fill:#d69e2e

title: Model Lifecycle Management
source:
flowchart TD
    D[Data Collection] --> T[Training]
    T --> V[Validation]
    V --> R{Metrics OK?}
    R -->|No| T
    R -->|Yes| Deploy[Deploy to Staging]
    Deploy --> AB[A/B Test]
    AB --> Prod[Production Rollout]
    Prod --> M[Monitor Metrics]
    M --> |Drift Detected| D
    style M fill:#ed8936

title: Observability Pipeline
source:
flowchart LR
    A[Application] --> L[Logs]
    A --> M[Metrics]
    A --> T[Traces]
    L --> F[Fluentd/Logstash]
    M --> P[Prometheus]
    T --> J[Jaeger]
    F --> E[Elasticsearch]
    P --> G[Grafana]
    J --> G
    E --> G
    style G fill:#d69e2e

title: At-Least-Once Delivery Semantics
source:
sequenceDiagram
    participant K as Kafka
    participant C as Consumer
    participant DB as Database
    K->>+C: Message 1
    C->>DB: Process & Store
    DB-->>C: Success
    C->>K: Commit Offset
    Note over K,C: Happy path
    K->>+C: Message 2
    C->>DB: Process & Store
    DB--xC: Failure
    Note over C: Don't commit offset
    C->>C: Retry
    C->>DB: Process & Store (duplicate)
    DB-->>C: Success
    C->>K: Commit Offset

title: Feature Store Architecture
source:
flowchart LR subgraph Online A[API Request] --> O[Online Store
Redis/DynamoDB] O --> I[Inference] end subgraph Offline B[Batch Jobs] --> OF[Offline Store
S3/BigQuery] OF --> T[Training] end D[Data Pipeline] --> O D --> OF style O fill:#48bb78 style OF fill:#4299e1

title: Autoscaling Based on Metrics
source:
flowchart TD
    M[Metrics: CPU, Latency, Queue Depth] --> HPA[Horizontal Pod Autoscaler]
    HPA --> D{Current vs Target}
    D -->|Above Target| U[Scale Up Pods]
    D -->|Below Target| Down[Scale Down Pods]
    D -->|Within Range| N[No Action]
    U --> W[Wait for Cooldown]
    Down --> W
    style HPA fill:#4299e1

title: Two-Tier Caching Strategy
source:
flowchart TD
    R[Request] --> E{ETS Cache Hit?}
    E -->|Yes| RE1[Return from ETS]
    E -->|No| R1{Redis Cache Hit?}
    R1 -->|Yes| RE2[Return from Redis + Update ETS]
    R1 -->|No| ML[Call ML Model]
    ML --> U[Update Redis + ETS]
    U --> RET[Return Prediction]
    style E fill:#48bb78
    style R1 fill:#ed8936
    style ML fill:#e53e3e

title: PostgreSQL Index Types
source:
flowchart TD Q[Query] --> I{Index Type} I -->|BTREE| B[Equality & Range
WHERE id = 5
WHERE age > 18] I -->|HASH| H[Equality Only
WHERE email = 'x@y.com'] I -->|GIN| G[Full-text Search
Array Containment
JSONB queries] I -->|GIST| GI[Geometric Data
Full-text Search
Range Types] style I fill:#d69e2e

title: Multi-Layer Fallback Architecture
source:
flowchart TD
    R[Request] --> L1{Local Cache}
    L1 -->|Hit| R1[Return Cached]
    L1 -->|Miss| L2{Edge Service}
    L2 -->|Available| R2[Return from Edge]
    L2 -->|Down| L3{Cloud Service}
    L3 -->|Available| R3[Return from Cloud]
    L3 -->|Down| F[Static Fallback/Error]
    style L1 fill:#48bb78
    style L2 fill:#ed8936
    style L3 fill:#e53e3e

title: Circuit Breaker for ML Service
source:
stateDiagram-v2
    [*] --> Closed
    Closed --> Open: Failures exceed threshold
    Open --> HalfOpen: After timeout
    HalfOpen --> Closed: Success
    HalfOpen --> Open: Failure
    note right of Closed: All requests pass through
    note right of Open: Fail fast, return fallback
    note right of HalfOpen: Test with limited requests

title: Query Optimization with EXPLAIN
source:
flowchart TD
    Q[Slow Query] --> E[EXPLAIN ANALYZE]
    E --> R{Findings}
    R --> S1[Sequential Scan]
    R --> S2[Hash Join Cost High]
    R --> S3[Sort Operation Expensive]
    S1 --> F1[Add Index]
    S2 --> F2[Increase work_mem]
    S3 --> F3[Add ORDER BY index]
    F1 --> T[Test Again]
    F2 --> T
    F3 --> T
    style E fill:#d69e2e

title: Rate Limiting with Token Bucket
source:
flowchart TD R[Request] --> B{Bucket Has Tokens?} B -->|Yes| C[Consume Token] C --> P[Process Request] B -->|No| Reject[Reject with 429] T[Token Refill:
+X tokens per second] --> Bu[Bucket] Bu --> B style B fill:#d69e2e style Reject fill:#e53e3e

title: Edge vs Cloud Inference Trade-offs
source:
flowchart LR R[Request] --> D{Latency Critical?} D -->|Yes| Edge[Edge Inference] D -->|No| Cloud[Cloud Inference] Edge --> E1[Lower Latency
Limited Model Size
Higher Cost per Node] Cloud --> C1[Higher Latency
Larger Models
Lower Cost at Scale] style Edge fill:#48bb78 style Cloud fill:#4299e1

title: Table Partitioning Strategy
source:
flowchart TD T[Large Table: events
100M+ rows] --> P[Partition by Date] P --> P1[events_2024_01] P --> P2[events_2024_02] P --> P3[events_2024_03] Q[Query: WHERE date = '2024-02'
AND user_id = 123] --> PP[Partition Pruning] PP --> P2 style PP fill:#48bb78

    C -->|"GenServer.cast(__MODULE__, {:increment_number, delta})"| E["State + delta"]
    E --> F["Handle Cast"]
    F --> D
    C -->|"{ :stop, reason, new_state }"| G["Terminate"]
    G --> H["Remove State"]

title: GenServer Sequence Example
source:
flowchart TD
    A["Sequence.Server"] -->|"{:ok, pid}"| B["start_link(123)"]
    B --> C["current_number = 123"]
    A -->|"next_number"| D["current_number + 1"]
    D --> E{"next_number"}
    A -->|"increment_number(100)"| F[":ok"]
    F --> G["current_number += 100"]
    E --- H["Show current_number" ]

title: Bitmap Access Protocols in Elixir
source:

    A -->|"get(bit)"| C["Access"]
    C -->|"if value &&& (1 <<< bit) == 0"| D["0"]
    C -->|"else"| E["1"]
    A -->|"get_and_update(bitmap, bit, accessor_fn)"| F["update value"]
    F --> G["%Bitmap{value: new_value}"]
    A -->|"count()"| H["Enumerable"]
    H -->|"{ :ok, count }"| I["Tuple"]
    H -->|"member?(bit_number)"| J["{ :ok, boolean }"]

    C -->|"send next_pid, n + 1"| D["next process"]
    D --> C
    D -->|"send last, 0"| E["last process"]
    E -->|"final_answer when is_integer(final_answer)"| F["result"]
    F --> G["Result message"]

    C -->|"{76550, Result is 10000}"| D["Chain.run(400_000)"]

    E -->|"Chain.run(400_000)"| F["{3210704, Result is 400000}"]
    F -->|"Chain.run(1_000_000)"| G["{7225292, Result is 1000000}"]
